labels.analysis: The MCP Server described, "SearchAPI Server," primarily functions as a gateway that connects AI assistants to external search engines (Google, Bing, YouTube) through a standardized interface. It provides tools for performing web, image, and video searches, with support for pagination, filtering, and formatted results. The server emphasizes easy integration with AI systems via CLI or HTTP transports, enabling automated or AI-driven search capabilities.
labels.reasoning: The primary label, "Web Search & Research," is chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around facilitating searches on external platforms (Google, YouTube) and returning structured data. While it enables automation, its primary use case is providing search results rather than browser automation. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories sufficiently cover its functionality.

tools.name: search_google
tools.description:
Performs a Google search using SearchAPI.site. 
Requires a search "query" string, can be able to search multiple keywords that separated by commas.
Returns formatted search results including titles, snippets, and links.
Create your SearchAPI.site API key at https://searchapi.site/profile

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return (1-100)

from_date.description: Start date for filtering results (format: YYYY-MM-DD)

to_date.description: End date for filtering results (format: YYYY-MM-DD)

tools.name: search_google_images
tools.description:
Performs a Google image search using SearchAPI.site.
Requires a search query and your SearchAPI.site API key.
Returns formatted image search results including titles, thumbnails, and source links.
Create your SearchAPI.site API key at https://searchapi.site/profile

query.description: The image search query to perform

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return (1-100)

from_date.description: Start date for filtering results (format: YYYY-MM-DD)

to_date.description: End date for filtering results (format: YYYY-MM-DD)

tools.name: search_youtube
tools.description:
Performs a YouTube search using SearchAPI.site.
Requires a search query and your SearchAPI.site API key.
Returns formatted YouTube search results including video titles, thumbnails, descriptions, and links.
Supports optional parameters for pagination, sorting, filtering by date and duration.
Create your SearchAPI.site API key at https://searchapi.site/profile

query.description: The YouTube search query to perform

maxResults.description: Maximum number of results to return (1-50)

pageToken.description: Token for pagination to get next/previous page of results

publishedAfter.description: Number of days to filter videos from

server_info_crawled.name: SearchAPI Server
server_info_crawled.author: @mrgoonie/searchapi-mcp-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Connect AI assistants to external search data sources like Google and Bing via SearchAPI.site. Perform web, image, and YouTube searches seamlessly through a standardized MCP interface. Enable easy integration with AI systems using CLI or HTTP transports for flexible deployment.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

config = {
  "debug": false,
  "ipapiApiToken": ""
}
# Encode config in base64
config_b64 = base64.b64encode(json.dumps(config).encode()).decode()
smithery_api_key = ""

# Create server URL
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@mrgoonie/searchapi-mcp-server/mcp?config={config_b64}&api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
